areaSection: Alicante is Costa Blanca's largest city and primary economic hub, positioned on Spain's southeastern Mediterranean coast. Alicante's geography features a dramatic coastline with multiple Blue Flag beaches, inland hills offering scenic views, and a temperate Mediterranean climate with 300+ days of sunshine annually. The city has evolved from a traditional trading port into a modern European destination, combining historic architecture with contemporary infrastructure. The region's elevation and coastal breezes create pleasant conditions year-round, with average winter temperatures around 13°C and summer temperatures reaching 28-30°C.

The Regional Hospital Universitario serves major medical needs with modern facilities and English-speaking staff. Multiple private clinics throughout the city offer rapid appointments and comprehensive services familiar to international patients. Dental clinics specializing in cosmetic and general dentistry are abundant and competitively priced. Pharmacies are widespread—Spanish pharmacists can dispense medications without prescription for common conditions. Travel medical insurance for residents is affordable and comprehensive. Emergency services (112) are efficient and professional.

faqs.question: Czy Costa Blanca to dobre miejsce na zakup nieruchomości?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca has experienced consistent 8% year-on-year property appreciation, established rental demand from millions of annual tourists, excellent healthcare and infrastructure, and a mature legal framework. The region attracts 9+ million visitors annually, creating reliable rental income streams. Alicante specifically offers the best value within the region.

faqs.question: Czy obcokrajowcy mogą kupić nieruchomość w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Yes, completely. Non-residents and non-EU citizens can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. You'll need an NIE (Spanish tax number), which takes 1-2 weeks to obtain. Purchase costs are transparent: typically 8-10% of property price including legal fees, transfer tax, and registration. The process is straightforward and fully protected by law.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty zakupu nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs total approximately 8-10% of property price: transfer tax (6-8% depending on region), legal fees (€1,000-2,000), and registration (€200-400). Annual holding costs include property tax (€150-300 for this property), community fees if applicable, and insurance (€100-150). These costs are significantly lower than Northern Europe.

faqs.question: Ile wynosi podatek od nieruchomości w Hiszpanii?
faqs.answer: Property tax (IBI) ranges from 0.4-0.8% of cadastral value annually—for this property, expect €120-200 per year. This is substantially lower than UK council tax or equivalent European taxes. Additionally, rental income is taxed at progressive rates (19-45%), but expenses reduce taxable income significantly.

faqs.question: Czy mogę uzyskać kredyt hipoteczny w Hiszpanii jako obcokrajowiec?
faqs.answer: Yes. Several Spanish banks offer mortgages to non-residents, typically 50-70% LTV (loan-to-value). Interest rates are competitive (3-4% for fixed 20-year terms). You'll need proof of income, a Spanish bank account, and possibly a guarantor. Alternative financing includes UK mortgages (some lenders offer Spanish property mortgages) or cash purchases—€164,900 is affordable for most serious investors.

faqs.question: Jakie są koszty życia na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living is 30-40% lower than UK. Groceries, utilities, and dining cost significantly less. A comfortable monthly budget for one person is €800-1,200 including rent, food, utilities, and entertainment. Healthcare costs are minimal for residents. This affordability extends to rental property maintenance and management—property management companies charge 15-20% of rental income.

faqs.question: Jakie dochody z wynajmu mogę oczekiwać od tej nieruchomości?
faqs.answer: €800 per week (€3,200 monthly) is the typical rate for 1-bedroom apartments in Centro Alicante during peak season, with €500-600 weekly in shoulder seasons. Annual gross income ranges €30,000-40,000 depending on occupancy. After management fees (15-20%), property tax, insurance, and minimal maintenance, net annual yield is 18-22%—exceptional for European property.

faqs.question: Jak daleko jest Costa Blanca od Polski?
faqs.answer: 2-3 hours by direct flight from London or Manchester. Alicante-Elche Airport has 30+ weekly flights to UK destinations. Flights typically cost €40-120 return during off-peak periods. This accessibility makes property management straightforward for UK-based owners and attracts high volume of British tourists for rental bookings.

faqs.question: Jaka jest pogoda na Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: 300+ days of sunshine annually with average temperatures 13°C (winter) to 28-30°C (summer). Mediterranean climate offers mild winters without harsh freezing and warm summers moderated by coastal breezes. This weather drives consistent tourism year-round, supporting reliable rental income across all seasons. Rainfall is minimal, and storms are rare.
